intro: Ptisana grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered ptisana, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Ptisana grandifolia features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow to orange composite flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
